question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the generated code is executable for display whenever possible. Please help me implement the following requirement using SVG code: Create a green clover, which is a heart-shaped plant found in nature.

checklist.title: Is the core clover shape accurately implemented with SVG?
checklist.description: Check if the code properly creates a four-leaf clover using SVG path elements or shape combinations. The clover should have four distinct heart-shaped leaves arranged symmetrically. Deduct 5 points if the leaves don't resemble hearts, 5 points if the arrangement isn't symmetrical, and 10 points if fewer than four leaves are implemented. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the green coloration appropriate and natural?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the clover uses appropriate green tones (like #00AA00, #228B22, or #008000) that look natural. Check if there's color variation or gradient to create depth. Deduct 3 points for unnatural green shades, 5 points for flat single-color implementation without depth, and 3 points if no different shades are used for different parts (leaves vs. stem). Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are additional botanical details included?
checklist.description: Check for realistic botanical elements like a stem, veins on the leaves, or subtle textures. Deduct 3 points if the stem is missing, 3 points if leaf veins are absent, and 4 points if there's no texture or detail work to make the clover look natural. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the SVG code optimized and efficient?
checklist.description: Review if the SVG implementation uses appropriate elements (paths, circles, etc.) efficiently. Check if the code uses groups (<g>) for related elements and proper coordinate systems. Deduct 3 points for excessive use of elements when fewer would suffice, 4 points for not using groups for logical organization, and 3 points for inefficient path commands. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle different display contexts (browser compatibility, scaling) and includes appropriate viewBox settings. Deduct 5 points if viewBox attribute is missing or improperly configured, 3 points if transforms aren't used appropriately for positioning, and 2 points if there are no fallbacks for older browsers. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Subtle animation like gentle swaying 2. Interactive elements like hover effects 3. Shadow or lighting effects). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Unnecessary SVG elements that don't contribute to the design 2. Overly complex paths that could be simplified 3. Excessive effects that distract from the core clover representation. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core representation is obscured by unnecessary elements.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review code organization, use of appropriate SVG attributes, and implementation of reusable components (if applicable). Deduct 5 points if SVG attributes are inconsistently applied or missing key parameters; deduct 3 points if similar elements aren't defined once and reused; deduct 2 points if the code lacks comments or clear structure. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the visual output meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the clover looks professional and polished: 1) Proportional leaf sizes and arrangement 2) Smooth curves without jagged edges 3) Proper use of visual hierarchy. Deduct 3 points for disproportionate elements, 4 points for visibly rough or uneven edges, and 3 points for poor visual balance. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are interactive or dynamic elements well-implemented?
checklist.description: Judge whether any animations or interactive features enhance the visual representation: 1) Smooth animations with appropriate timing 2) Purposeful interactions that add value 3) Elegant transitions. Deduct 3 points for animations that feel unnatural, 4 points for interactions without visual feedback, and 3 points for animations that hinder rather than enhance the representation. Full score is 10 points.
